home.description: Recent Programming graduate with a solid foundation in full-stack development gained during a significant internship, where I extensively used React and Node.js (Fastify, PostgreSQL). I am a fast learner, eager to contribute to a dynamic team in a junior developer role in the Antwerpen area and work with various technologies.
home.blogSectionIntro: My internship blog offers a week-by-week chronicle of my development journey, detailing practical problem-solving, technology adoption (React, PostgreSQL, Fastify), and overall growth as a software developer. It's a transparent look at my hands-on experience.
home.techDescription: Technical expertise and professional qualities I bring to development projects
home.projectsDescription: Explore a selection of my key projects, showcasing practical application of my technical skills and problem-solving abilities, including work from my recent software development internship.
home.experienceDescription: My professional journey in the tech industry so far, highlighting relevant development work and other valuable experience.
home.skillsDescription: Key technical and soft skills I bring to development projects, honed during my studies and practical internship experience.

intro.introP1: I am a junior full-stack developer based near Antwerp, Belgium, currently completing my programming studies and eager to launch my career. I have hands-on experience with a wide range of technologies. During my internship, I delivered a business management platform for Amotek and continue to broaden my experience with new projects. I am ready to join a dynamic team where I can contribute, learn, and grow .
intro.introP2: Available immediately for full-stack or backend roles.
intro.overviewProjectsDescription: Full-stack timesheet app, React components library
intro.overviewEducationDescription: Associate Degree in Programming (Graduaat Programmeren), AP Hogeschool
intro.overviewSkillsDescription: Proficient in backend and full-stack development using Node.js, Fastify, PostgreSQL, and React. Fast learner, adaptable, and eager to contribute to team success.
intro.overviewEducationSummary: Soon wil be Graduated with an Graduaat Degree in Programming from AP Hogeschool. Previous studies in Bachelor IT 2 year (not completed). Focus areas: API Development, Web Frameworks, Database Management.
intro.internshipHighlightDescription: Delivered AmoTrack, a business management platform, during my internship at Amotek. My role covered full-stack development, backend API design, and database architecture, working independently and collaborating with the team.

about.title: About Me: Junior Full-Stack & Backend Developer
about.subtitle: My journey, skills, and ambitions as a developer.
about.heroIntroSentence: Recently completed my Graduaat in Programming and gained practical experience through a software development internship.
about.introduction: As a recent Programming graduate based near Antwerpen, Belgium, I am actively seeking my first full-time Junior Developer position, with a strong interest in Full-Stack and Backend roles. My portfolio highlights the practical skills and hands-on experience gained during my studies and a significant software development internship. I am eager to contribute my abilities to a dynamic team and continue growing in a professional development environment.
about.educationText: I am currently completing my Graduaat in Programming at AP Hogeschool, building a strong foundation in both frontend and backend development. While I have a strong interest and aptitude for backend logic and architecture, I am also fully committed to strengthening my frontend skills to effectively contribute across the entire stack and understand the development of complete applications.
about.languagesText: As a native Spanish speaker, fluent in Dutch, and comfortable working in English, I am well-equipped for collaboration in diverse, international teams and able to easily access and understand technical resources in multiple languages.
about.aiTitle: My Perspective on AI in Development
about.aiPhilosophyText: I view AI as a powerful tool that can enhance developer productivity—excellent for suggesting code improvements, identifying potential issues, and accelerating routine tasks—but I emphasize that the developer must retain full control, understanding, and responsibility for the final code at all times.
about.aiApproach: How I Use It in Practice
about.aiApproachText: My primary uses of AI include generating code suggestions, refining existing code solutions, and assisting with documentation and explanations. I strictly adhere to best practices regarding data privacy and intellectual property, ensuring that no private or sensitive project code is ever shared with AI tools.
about.aiExample: For instance, during the development of this portfolio, I used AI for initial layout ideas and debugging support, but all architectural decisions, code implementation, and final content were entirely my own work.
about.goalsText: I aspire to become a skilled Full-Stack Developer with a particular interest in backend systems. My focus extends beyond just building new features; I am driven to maintain and optimize existing systems and ensure their long-term health and efficiency. This includes writing clean, maintainable code and contributing to robust architectures.
about.goalsPhilosophy: Contributing to the longevity and reliability of software is just as crucial as its initial creation. I value future-proof design and well-maintainable codebases.
about.methodsTitle: My Work Style and Learning Method
about.methodsText1: I build my knowledge by continuously learning new technologies while simultaneously deepening my understanding of fundamental programming principles and established best practices. This approach helps me find a balance between exploring innovation and effectively applying proven solutions.
about.methodsText2: My learning process is guided by foundational books like 'Clean Code', 'Head First Design Patterns', and 'Don't Make Me Think', combined with practical project work and utilizing AI-driven learning methods for support and exploration. My constant goal is to improve code quality, maintainability, and overall development efficiency.

descriptions.amotekInternship: Worked on the AmoTrack project, building a full-stack application that the company now uses internally and is ready for client deployment.
descriptions.beegoStudentJob: Provided on-site technical support to customers in their homes.

amotekInternship: Developed frontend components with React and TypeScript, creating a well-structured user interface
Implemented RESTful API endpoints using Fastify for backend development
Created database schemas and queries with PostgreSQL and Drizzle ORM
Worked primarily independently, occasionally collaborating with colleagues for guidance
beegoStudentJob: Visited customers' homes to resolve various technical issues with computers and devices
Provided clear explanations on safe internet navigation and cybersecurity best practices
Assisted elderly and non-technical users with setting up and troubleshooting their devices
Documented solutions for common problems to improve the company's knowledge base
techSupportCoStudentJob: Set up and configured computers and workstations for new employees
Assisted with network installations and basic troubleshooting
Learned the fundamentals of IT support and hardware maintenance
Gained valuable experience in the operational aspects of IT infrastructure

projects.featuredDescription: Explore a selection of my key projects. Public projects are available on GitHub, while private projects (like my internship work) are detailed in a modal due to confidentiality.

amotrack.overview: AmoTrack is a comprehensive full-stack application developed for Amotek's internal business tracking and project management needs. The system integrates time tracking, project management, client management, and reporting into a unified platform, providing a complete solution for the company's operational workflow.

features.timeTracking: Comprehensive time tracking with detailed timesheet management
features.projectManagement: Project tracking with tasks, deadlines, and resource allocation
features.clientManagement: Client information management and relationship tracking
features.userManagement: User administration with role-based access control
features.reporting: Detailed reporting and data visualization capabilities

amotrack.frontendDescription: Built with React and TypeScript, the frontend implements a modular component structure with custom hooks for different entity types. It leverages Tanstack Query for efficient API state management, React Router for seamless navigation, and integrates with a custom styling library for consistent UI components.
amotrack.backendDescription: Powered by Fastify and Node.js, the backend provides a high-performance RESTful API with comprehensive validation. It uses Drizzle ORM with PostgreSQL for type-safe database operations, implements JWT authentication, and includes Swagger documentation for API endpoints.

contributions.frontend: Developed responsive UI components with React and TypeScript, creating a well-structured user interface
contributions.backend: Implemented RESTful API endpoints using Fastify for efficient data handling and business logic
contributions.database: Designed database schemas and queries with PostgreSQL and Drizzle ORM for optimal data storage
contributions.api: Created comprehensive API documentation with Swagger for improved developer experience
contributions.deployment: Configured deployment pipelines and addressed DevOps challenges for smooth delivery

amotrack.challenge: The main challenge was creating a unified system that could handle complex relationships between clients, projects, tasks, and timesheets while maintaining data integrity and providing an intuitive user experience. Additionally, implementing proper authentication and authorization across both frontend and backend required careful coordination.
amotrack.solution: I implemented a well-structured database schema using Drizzle ORM that accurately modeled the relationships between entities. The backend was designed with clear separation of concerns (controllers, services, routes) for maintainability. On the frontend, I created reusable components and custom hooks for each entity type, ensuring consistent data handling and UI presentation. For authentication, I implemented a secure JWT-based system with role-based access control.
amotrack.outcome: The AmoTrack application was successfully delivered and is now used internally by Amotek for daily operations. The system has streamlined the company's project management and time tracking processes, providing valuable insights into resource allocation and project profitability. The codebase is well-structured and documented, making it easy to maintain and extend with new features as needed.

cvo.overview: A backend-focused automation project for CVO Antwerpen School, designed to optimize and automate core administrative processes. The system streamlines student registration, account creation, user management (students, teachers, admins), and dynamically links courses to teachers and students, with deep Google API integration.

features.item1: Automated student registration and account creation
features.item3: Dynamic linking of courses to teachers and students
features.item4: Full Google Classroom automation (classroom creation, course linking, assignment management)
features.item5: Automated Google account management for students and teachers
features.item6: Secure RESTful API endpoints for all automated processes

cvo.backendApiIntegrationDescription: The system is built in C# with custom API models and services, focusing on secure, scalable backend logic. Extensive Google API integration (Classroom, Directory, Gmail) automates educational workflows and user management. Data serialization, email handling, and web automation libraries support robust, automated operations.

contributions.item1: Led the development of Google API integration (Classroom, Directory, Gmail)
contributions.item2: Connected school system with Google accounts for seamless automation
contributions.item3: Automated Google Classroom creation, course linking, and user assignments
contributions.item4: Designed and implemented secure RESTful endpoints for all automated processes
contributions.item5: Conducted extensive research on Google API documentation and best practices
contributions.item6: Ensured secure coding and efficient data flow throughout the project

cvo.challenge: The most significant challenge was thoroughly reading and interpreting the extensive Google API documentation to identify robust, secure integration patterns. Secure coding practices and careful architectural decisions were essential to ensure data privacy and system reliability.
cvo.solution: I implemented a modular, secure backend architecture with custom C# services and models, leveraging Google APIs for automation. Security was prioritized at every step, and RESTful endpoints were designed for maintainability and extensibility.
cvo.outcome: The CVO Antwerpen automation system was successfully implemented, significantly reducing administrative overhead and streamlining educational workflows. The integration with Google services created a seamless experience for students and teachers, while the secure backend architecture ensured data privacy and system reliability.

blog.title: My Software Development Internship Journey
blog.description: Follow my week-by-week experiences, challenges, and lessons learned during my hands-on software development internship.

week1.title: Week 1
week1.overview: Started the internship with project onboarding. Focused on understanding the existing coding architecture (AmoDrive) and project structure, working with Storybook components, and improving coding style based on senior feedback. Gained practical experience using Git/GitHub workflows, resolved various technical errors, and successfully finalized tickets related to forms, cards, and modals.

week2.title: Week 2
week2.overview: Initiated work on the AmoTrack project, engaging with the core tech stack: React, PostgreSQL, Drizzle, and Fastify. Successfully set up the database, established connection, and developed the first CRUD endpoint. Received valuable feedback on logical thinking and collaboration. Created new endpoints, optimized server files, and started working on tickets for the user interface and API performance, gaining experience with ticket and PR workflows.

week3.title: Week 3
week3.overview: Focused on refining work based on feedback and tackling new tickets. Addressed challenges related to coding style consistency by learning from different seniors. Received positive feedback on Pull Requests and successfully completed and obtained approval for outstanding tasks from the first week. Continued developing skills in backend development.

week4.title: Week 4
week4.overview: Achieved a key milestone by presenting a demo of the AmoTrack frontend and backend development progress to the senior team. Implemented significant functions in form components and resolved backend bugs. Focused on making components more generic and reusable. Received positive feedback, motivating further dedication to project development and skill improvement.

week5.title: Week 5
week5.overview: Primarily focused on managing and addressing Pull Requests (PRs) and continuing frontend development for AmoTrack, including updating forms. Successfully finalized remaining backend tasks. Started a small personal project ('Mini Mike') based on senior guidance, aimed at reinforcing learning and practical skills.

week6.title: Week 6
week6.overview: Engaged with DevOps aspects, tackling Azure challenges and deployment issues, including optimizing 'chunk size reduction' via GitHub Actions. Continued frontend development work on assigned tickets. Collaborated with a colleague to troubleshoot and resolve deployment problems and contributed to updating the AmoStyle library. Provided constructive feedback on a colleague's project.

week7.title: Week 7
week7.overview: Dedicated the week entirely to working on the Amo-style-library. This involved rewriting existing components based on the decision to move away from using MUI, focusing on custom implementation, component testing, and library maintenance.

week8.title: Week 8
week8.overview: A quieter week focusing on integrating feedback from my interim evaluation. Continued frontend refinement based on senior advice, independently addressing and fixing bugs. Developed new UI components including input fields, radio fields, and checkbox fields, demonstrating growing autonomy. Engaged in detailed review of feedback and technical documentation.

week9.title: Week 9
week9.overview: Transitioned back to working on both the frontend and backend of the AmoTrack project after finalizing Amo Style Library tasks. Pick up new tickets assigned by the senior team, focused on implementing new features and updates across the stack. Gained experience with API documentation by creating Swagger specifications.

week10.title: Week 10
week10.overview: Shifted full focus to the AmoTrack project, actively contributing to both frontend and backend development. Updated frontend components, resolved bugs, and processed translation feedback. Further enhanced API documentation by setting up Swagger. Began implementing core backend features, including soft deletion logic for data management.

week11.title: Week 11
week11.overview: Dedicated the week to finalizing assigned tickets for the AmoTrack project. Successfully reached a major development milestone by fully implementing the complete timesheet logic, a core feature. Focused on thorough testing and preparation for upcoming demos, demonstrating ability to complete feature development cycles.

week12.title: Week 12
week12.overview: Achieved high productivity by focusing exclusively on assigned development tickets. Rebuilt and refined several pages based on new design feedback to enhance user experience and interface usability. Prepared the codebase and architecture for the upcoming implementation of the API gateway.

week13.title: Week 13
week13.overview: Focused heavily on finalization and refinement of critical application components. Completed and refined the timesheet feature, implemented and thoroughly tested the login functionality, and completed the translation of all application pages into English. Prepared to finalize user authentication flows and address remaining design feedback.

week14.title: Week 14
week14.overview: Engaged in advanced topics and codebase optimization. Conducted self-study and implemented React Query for improved data fetching and state management. Researched testing methodologies and performance optimizations. Refactored and cleaned up existing code, implemented robust role checks for access control, and further refined login functionality and the timesheet feature. Enhanced UI details by styling project components.
